member.name: T:Mapsui.Layers.ObservableMemoryLayer`1
member.summary: Represents a memory-based layer that exposes its data as an observable collection and synchronizes feature changes with the underlying feature set.
member.remarks: This class enables two-way synchronization between an ObservableCollection of items and the set of features exposed by the layer. Changes to the collection are automatically reflected in the feature set, and vice versa. This is useful for scenarios where UI or other components need to observe and react to changes in the layer's data in real time.
member.typeparam: The type of items contained in the observable collection. Must be a reference type.

member.name: M:Mapsui.Layers.ObservableMemoryLayer`1.#ctor(System.Func{`0,Mapsui.IFeature},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ObservableMemoryLayer class with the specified feature selector and optional name.
member.param: A function gets the IFeature instance related to the item of type T. This function is used to map items in the layer to their corresponding features. Cannot be null.
The optional name to assign to the layer. If null, a default name based on the type is used.

member.name: P:Mapsui.Layers.ObservableMemoryLayer`1.ObservableCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying collection of items to observe for changes.
member.remarks: Assigning a new collection will update the internal state to reflect the contents of the provided collection and subscribe to its change notifications. If the collection is replaced, any previous event subscriptions are removed. Setting this property to null will clear the internal state and unsubscribe from change notifications.

member.summary: Schedules the specified asynchronous function to be executed after a minimum delay, ensuring that at least milliseconds have elapsed since the previous execution. If multiple calls are made in quick succession, only the most recent is executed.
member.param: The minimum number of milliseconds between two executions.
The minimum number of milliseconds to wait after calling this method before executing . . This is useful when starting continuous changes, like dragging the map.

members.member:
Indicates that there has been a change in the view of the map
If Discrete an implementation should always refresh it's data. If Continuous the implementation could ignore it. Example: During dragging a map a WMS layer would not want to fetch data, only on the drag end. FetchInfo

member.name: T:Mapsui.Fetcher.LatestMailbox`1
member.summary: A thread-safe mailbox that always holds at most one message of type . When a new message is added, it overwrites any existing message. This is useful in scenarios where only the most recent message is relevant, such as UI or viewport updates, and outdated messages should be ignored.
member.typeparam: The type of message to store. Must be a reference type.

member.name: M:Mapsui.Fetcher.LatestMailbox`1.Overwrite(`0)
member.summary: Stores the specified message in the mailbox, replacing any previous message. If a message was already present, it is discarded and replaced by the new one.
member.param: The message to store. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Mapsui.Fetcher.LatestMailbox`1.TryTake(`0@)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve and remove the current message from the mailbox. If a message is present, it is returned and the mailbox is cleared. If no message is present, returns false.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the message retrieved from the mailbox, or null if the mailbox was empty.
member.returns: True if a message was present and retrieved; false if the mailbox was empty.

member.name: M:Mapsui.Styles.Color.FromString(System.String)
member.summary:
Converts a string in Mapbox GL format to a Mapsui Color
This function assumes, that alpha is a float in range from 0.0 to 1.0. It converts this float in Mapsui Color alpha without rounding. The following colors could be converted: - Named colors with known Html names - Colors as Html color values with leading '#' and 6 or 3 numbers - Function rgb(r,g,b) with values for red, green and blue - Function rgba(r,g,b,a) with values for red, green, blue and alpha. Here alpha is between 0.0 and 1.0 like opacity. - Function hsl(h,s,l) with values hue (0.0 to 360.0), saturation (0.0% - 100.0%) and lightness (0.0% - 100.0%) - Function hsla(h,s,l,a) with values hue (0.0 to 360.0), saturation (0.0% - 100.0%), lightness (0.0% - 100.0%) and alpha. Here alpha is between 0.0 and 1.0 like opacity.
member.param: String with HTML color representation or function like rgb() or hsl()
member.returns: Converted Mapsui Color

member.name: T:Mapsui.Styles.RelativeOffset
member.summary: Offset relative to the size of the item to which it applies. The unit of measure is the width or height of an image. A relative offset of X = 0, and Y = 0 will be centered. An offset of (0.5, 0.5) the symbol will be moved half the width of the image to the right and half the height of the image to the top. So the bottom left point of the image will be on the location.

member.summary: Defines arrays of colors and positions used for interpolating color blending in a multicolor gradient.

member.summary: Gets or sets an array of colors that represents the colors to use at corresponding positions along a gradient.

member.name: P:Mapsui.Styles.Thematics.ColorBlend.Positions
member.summary: Gets or sets the positions along a gradient line.
member.value: An array of values that specify percentages of distance along the gradient line.

remarks.para: The elements of this array specify percentages of distance along the gradient line. For example, an element value of 0.2f specifies that this point is 20 percent of the total distance from the starting point. The elements in this array are represented by float values between 0.0f and 1.0f, and the first element of the array must be 0.0f and the last element must be 1.0f.
remarks.pre: Along with the Colors property, this property defines a multicolor gradient.

member.name: M:Mapsui.Utilities.TransformationAlgorithms.CalculateCenterOfMap(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the new CenterOfMap based on the CenterOfZoom and the new resolution. The CenterOfZoom is not the same as the CenterOfMap. CenterOfZoom is the one place in the map that stays on the same location when zooming. In Mapsui is can be equal to the CenterOfMap, for instance when using the +/- buttons. When using mouse wheel zoom the CenterOfZoom is the location of the mouse.
member.returns: The x and y of the center of the map.

member.name: P:Mapsui.Viewport.Resolution
member.summary: Resolution of the viewport in units per pixel
member.remarks:
The Resolution in Mapsui is what is often called zoom level. Because Mapsui is projection independent, there aren't any zoom levels as other map libraries have. If your map has EPSG:3857 as projection and you want to calculate the zoom, you should use the following equation
var zoom = (float)Math.Log(78271.51696401953125 / resolution, 2);

member.name: T:Mapsui.Widgets.ScaleBar.ScaleBarWidget
member.summary:
A ScaleBarWidget displays the ratio of a distance on the map to the corresponding distance on the ground. It uses always the center of a given Viewport to calc this ratio.
Usage To show a ScaleBarWidget, add a instance of the ScaleBarWidget to Map.Widgets by
map.Widgets.Add(new ScaleBarWidget(map));
Customize ScaleBarMode: Determines, how much scalebars are shown. Could be Single or Both. SecondaryUnitConverter: First UnitConverter for upper scalebar. There are UnitConverters for metric, imperial and nautical units. SecondaryUnitConverter = NauticalUnitConverter.Instance }); MaxWidth: Maximal width of the scalebar. Real width could be smaller. HorizontalAlignment: Where the ScaleBarWidget is shown. Could be Left, Right, Center or Position. VerticalAlignment: Where the ScaleBarWidget is shown. Could be Top, Bottom, Center or Position. PositionX: If HorizontalAlignment is Position, this value determines the distance to the left PositionY: If VerticalAlignment is Position, this value determines the distance to the top TextColor: Color for text and lines Halo: Color used around text and lines, so the scalebar is better visible TextAlignment: Alignment of scalebar text to the lines. Could be Left, Right or Center TextMargin: Space between text and lines of scalebar Font: Font which is used to draw text TickLength: Length of the ticks at scalebar

members.member: Default position of the scale bar.

member.summary: Maximum usable width for scalebar. The real used width could be less, because we want only integers as text.
